title: Higher Education Job-Based Mathematics Learning: Mobile Microlearning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Practical mathematics application course for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields, operated in smartphone-based resource-constrained environments with project-based assessments emphasizing job-related problem-solving competencies

learning_goals: Apply basic concepts of statistics and probability theory for practical data analysis.

Learners represent three or more job-related problems (e.g., budget optimization, process efficiency analysis) as mathematical models (linear/nonlinear equations, probability models, etc.) and derive solutions with over 80% accuracy using computational tools (Excel, Python, etc.).

Collaborating with two team members via mobile learning platforms (Google Jamboard, Notion, etc.), learners submit differential equation modeling project outputs in PDF and video formats with three or more visualizations, achieving ‘excellent’ ratings in four out of five peer evaluation rubric items.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
